meanings.definition: To certify or attest to the authenticity of a document by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: She was notarising the contract to make it official.
meanings.sent2: The notary was notarising the will for legal purposes.
meanings.sent3: The notary public was notarising documents like a pro.
meanings.sent4: Her stamp of approval was notarising the papers with authority.
meanings.sent5: Notarising the deed ensured its validity in the eyes of the law.

meanings.definition: The act of having a document officially witnessed and signed by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: The notarising of the will was necessary for it to be valid.
meanings.sent2: He requested the notarising of the contract before finalizing the deal.
meanings.sent3: The notarising of the papers brought a sense of formality to the process.
meanings.sent4: The notarising of the document was like adding a seal of approval.
meanings.sent5: The notarising of the agreement was a crucial step in the legal procedure.
